thread.title: Cubs Fan Spells Out Playoff Prank
thread.title_full: Cubs Fan Spells Out Playoff Prank

title: Cubs Fan Spells Out Playoff Prank
text:
Travis Mpistolarides A Chicago Cubs fan may have just pulled off the best prank ever. The Chicago Cubs are set to take on the Pittsburgh Pirates in the National League Wild Card Game at PNC Park Wednesday night, but a display of hometown pride for the Pirates was transformed into Cubs pride just hours before the big match. Chicago fan Steve Mpistolarides went into an office building across the street from PNC Park and changed a sign from “Let’s Go Bucs” to “Let’s Go Cubs," according to the Mpistolarides family. For those who didn't know, the Pirates are often referred to as the “Bucs.” Woman Found Dead at Suburban Storage Facility “So we're at a bar right next to PNC and there's an office building that reads lets go bucs,” a Facebook post from Mpistolarides' son Travis read. “My dad goes in the elevator low key to the office and switches it to let's go Cubs. Somehow nobody saw him ‪#‎wearegood‬.” 
So we're at a bar right next to PNC and there's an office building that reads lets go bucs. My dad goes in the elevator low key to the office and switches it to let's go Cubs. Somehow nobody saw him #wearegood The family even sent the photos and video to NBC Chicago to prove it. Published 5 hours ago
